news_header: South Korea's impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol faces insurrection charges in court, marking a historic trial for a president.
news_original_title: South Korea: President Yoon faces criminal trial
news_text: Yoon Suk Yeol, South Korea's impeached president, appeared in court for insurrection charges, becoming the first president to face such a trial. He imposed martial law briefly, leading to his impeachment. Prosecutors accuse him of being the 'ringleader of an insurrection.' Yoon denies wrongdoing, claiming his actions were legitimate.
